Hiding the discount disclosure in an unrelated section obscures the reporting requirements, potentially leading to violations of anti-kickback statutes and false claims regulations.

perturbation.original_text: 21.2 Dispute Resolution. If there is a disagreement between the PPI and EKR on the interpretation of this Agreement or any aspect of the performance by either Party of its obligations under this Agreement, the Parties shall resolve the dispute in accordance with the dispute resolution procedure set out in Schedule VIII.
perturbation.changed_text: 21.2 Dispute Resolution. If there is a disagreement between the PPI and EKR on the interpretation of this Agreement or any aspect of the performance by either Party of its obligations under this Agreement, the Parties may, if both agree, resolve the dispute in accordance with the dispute resolution procedure set out in Schedule VIII.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall' to 'may', the dispute resolution process becomes optional, undermining the contract's enforceability. Mandatory arbitration is required for most contracts in New York. This introduces ambiguity about how disputes will be handled, potentially invalidating the dispute resolution clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York Civil Practice Law and Rules (CPLR) §7503
perturbation.law_explanation: NY CPLR §7503 outlines the procedure for compelling or staying arbitration. By making the dispute resolution process optional, the contract could be interpreted as not creating a binding agreement to arbitrate, potentially nullifying the ability to compel arbitration under New York law. This creates a structural flaw that impacts enforceability of mandatory arbitration.
